Sentencas: One approach to improve the performances of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) cathodes is to use a composite electrode that typically consists of a two-phase porous mixture of a solid electrolyte (yttria-stabilized zirconia) and an electrocatalytic material.
Titulo: Micromodeling of functionally graded SOFC cathodes

Sentencas: The best electrochemical performances with such a type of cathode are obtained when the composition varies within the composite cathode called graded electrode.
Titulo: Micromodeling of functionally graded SOFC cathodes

Sentencas: The present modeling has been performed in order to give a complete description of the electrode microstructure, as well as the process occurring therein.
Titulo: Micromodeling of functionally graded SOFC cathodes

Sentencas: A one-dimensional, homogeneous model and a discrete element method was used.
Titulo: Micromodeling of functionally graded SOFC cathodes

Sentencas: The present study proposes a one-dimensional dc and ac model that takes into account mass and charge conservation, transport of species, and reaction kinetics.
Titulo: Micromodeling of functionally graded SOFC cathodes

Sentencas: The influence of transport parameters and microstructure on the shape of both polarization curves and impedance diagrams is discussed.
Titulo: Micromodeling of functionally graded SOFC cathodes
